definitions: Moving quickly and awkwardly, typically on hands and knees.
Making one's way quickly or with difficulty up a steep gradient or over rough ground.
Competing or struggling with others for something in a disorderly way.
Mixing or stirring (eggs) together and cooking them until set.
Making (a radio or telephone message) unintelligible during transmission and intelligible again on reception.
examples: The children were scrambling over the rocks.
He was scrambling to finish his report before the deadline.
The chef was scrambling eggs for breakfast.
They were scrambling to get the best seats.
The device is scrambling the signal.
